p: As SARS-CoV-2 has not been identified for a few months in humans, there is no specific treatment [ 13]. Given the growing number of reported cases, suspected patients must be diagnosed as quickly as possible to isolate and limit further transmission [ 13]. Conventional methods such as assays for detecting viral antigens or antiviral antibodies and newer methods of diagnosis as multiplex nucleic acid amplification have been developed and used clinically [ 13].
